page.title: 17Population in rural Sowerby
page.content: The population is a scattered working population, and as such tends to be under 60 years old. When farmers reach retiring age or there abouts, they tend to move out of thefarm houses into less isolated homes in near by villages,leaving the farm house for the eldest son and his family. Many of the farms and "tied" cottages have school age children and primary aged children go to local village schools. The older children go to the comprehensive school at Thirsk. Generally speaking, farmers and farm workers get on very well together,though socially farmers mix with farmers and farm workers with other workers.
